description:
Marital status

Explanatory notes for the following statistics:
12211 Microcensus

Definition:
The marital status specifies to which of the following four
groups a person belongs: single, married, widowed, or
divorced.

Married people are all persons in a marriage or registered
life partnership. People whose partner is missing but has
not been declared dead yet are regarded as married, and
persons whose partner has been declared dead as widowed. If
the partners are separated but no decree of divorce has been
pronounced, they are considered as married. The same applies
to people who are in the process of getting divorced as long
as the decree of divorce has not been issued.
People whose marriage or registered life partnership has
been annulled/dissolved by judicial decision are considered
as divorced. People whose marriage or registered life
partnership has been declared void are recorded as having
the marital status they had beforehand.
Single people include all persons who are not married,
widowed or divorced.
